citeinfo.title: Nutrient and sediment concentrations, loads, yields, and rainfall characteristics at USGS surface and subsurface-tile edge-of-field agricultural monitoring sites in Great Lakes States (ver. 3.0, November 2024)

descript.abstract:
This data release provides computed rainfall (rain total, duration, intensity, erosivity and antecedent rainfall) and flow (flow volume, flow-weighted mean concentrations, total loads, and total yields) metrics from monitored precipitation, discharge, and water quality (nutrients and sediment concentrations) data collected at U.S. Geological Survey edge-of-field (EOF) monitoring sites located in five Great Lakes States (Wisconsin, Michigan, Ohio, Indiana, and New York). EOF monitoring sites are installed at the edge of agricultural fields, either on the field surface or using subsurface tiles, where runoff can be intercepted and channeled through monitoring equipment before it enters the natural stream system. The methods used to collect this data followed USGS EOF monitoring methods (https://pubs.usgs.gov/of/20081015/). These EOF monitoring sites are located at private farms under a variety of farming systems, landscape settings, drainage areas, soil types, and climates. Site information is provided in the ‘EOF_Site_Table.csv’ data table.
Rainfall metrics were computed for EOF site locations and are provided in the ‘All_EOF_RainEvents.csv’ data table. Rainfall was directly monitored at many, but not every EOF monitoring site. EOF monitoring sites without on-site rainfall data were associated to rainfall data measured at a nearby EOF monitoring site or meteorological site. Rainfall was combined into a single event if it occurred within 2 hours of the previous rainfall.
Flow data were computed for each flow event at each EOF monitoring site and are available in the ‘All_EOF_StormEventLoadsFormatted.csv’ data table. A flow event was defined as any period of flow at a site that was classified as a storm and represents flow that was related to rainfall or snowmelt. There were occurrences of continuous flow between rain events, which were not associated with a period of rainfall or snowmelt, likely due to excessive soil saturation or shallow groundwater discharge. These periods of intermittent tile discharge were not classified as a storm.
Multiple precipitation and flow events were combined if they occurred within two hours of each other to account for similar rainfall/runoff characteristics. Rainfall metrics and flow data were then calculated for these combined events at each EOF monitoring site and available in the ‘All_EOF_StormEventLoadsRainCalculated.csv’ data table.
descript.purpose: Precipitation, discharge, and water quality (nutrients and sediment concentrations) data were collected at U.S. Geological Survey edge-of-field (EOF) monitoring sites located in five Great Lakes States (Wisconsin, Michigan, Ohio, Indiana, and New York). This data release combines flow totals with sampled sediment and nutrient concentrations to produce flow-weighted concentrations, total loads, and total yields for each distinct flow event. These data support five local, state, and federal cooperative programs (Great Lakes Restoration Initiative – Priority Watersheds, University of Wisconsin Discovery Farms, University of Wisconsin-Platteville Pioneer Farm, Sand County Foundation, and Mississippi River Basin Initiative) with goals of characterizing agricultural influences on water quality and/or documenting water-quality changes attributable to conservation practice implementation. Specifically, edge-of-field monitoring was conducted year-round to evaluate flow characteristics among seasons and variation in weather, field conditions, and agricultural activities.

attracc.attraccr: No formal attribute accuracy tests were conducted.

dataqual.logic: All attributes were checked for outliers and if data were within the allowed range for the data.
dataqual.complete: Data set is considered complete for the information presented, as described in the abstract. Users are advised to read the rest of the metadata record carefully for additional details

horizpa.horizpar: No formal positional accuracy tests were conducted

vertacc.vertaccr: No formal positional accuracy tests were conducted

procstep.procdesc: Site Information: General site information for Edge-of-field (EOF) and precipitation monitoring sites was provided by the USGS National Water Information System at https://dx.doi.org/10.5066/F7P55KJN. Farming practices that take place on the agricultural field for each EOF monitoring site were obtained through conversations with farm operators. Land use data were obtained from the National Land cover Database (Dewitz, 2021). Primary soil type was obtained from the National Resources Conservation Service Soil Survey (NRCS, 2021).

Field Methods and Data Analysis: EOF monitoring data including precipitation, discharge, and water-quality (nutrient and sediment concentrations) data were collected and processed using the methods in Stuntebeck and others (2008). Discharge, derived from stage, and water-quality data were collected at each EOF monitoring site, while precipitation data was directly monitored at several EOF sites. Water-quality data were analyzed at the University of Wisconsin-Stevens Point Water and Environmental Analysis Lab (WEAL). Precipitation and discharge data were analyzed using methods in Stuntebeck and others (2008). All these data are available in the USGS National Water Information System at https://dx.doi.org/10.5066/F7P55KJN. Water-quality concentration data were provided at the resolution (i.e., significant digits) reported by the laboratory.

Flow Metric Calculations: Flow metrics were calculated for each flow event using discharge and water-quality data collected from at each EOF monitoring site per methods in Stuntebeck and others (2008). - Runoff volumes were calculated for each sample collected during an event by summing the time-series discharge values, in cubic feet per second, by the appropriate time period, in seconds, and reported in cubic feet (CF; Stuntebeck and others, 2008). - Loads were calculated for each runoff event by multiplying the analyte flow-weighted mean concentration in milligrams per liter (mg/L), runoff volume (CF), and two-unit conversions (28.3168 L/CF and 1 pound per 453592 mg) and reported in pounds. If the analyte concentration result value was below the method detection limit (i.e. left censored), half the detection limit was used in the load calculation. - Estimated loads were calculated for runoff events when samples were not collected to compute an annual load. Event-mean concentrations from the sampled runoff event that most represented the qualities of the unsampled event were used as estimates for unsampled events in the load calculation (Stuntebeck and others 2008). Estimated loads are denoted in the data so they can easily be removed for event-based analysis. - Yields were calculated for each runoff event by dividing the analyte load by the site catchment (or drainage) area and reported in pounds/acre.

Rainfall Metric Calculations: Rainfall metrics were calculated using methods in Wischmeier and Smith (1978 and 1981) and McGregor and others (1995) for each rainfall event using precipitation data collected from sites monitoring precipitation. As previously mentioned in processing step 2, EOF monitoring sites in close proximity shared precipitation data. - Intensity for each event was calculated by dividing the total amount of rain from the event by the length of time (‘duration’) of the event and reported in inches per hour (in/hr). - Maximum interval intensity for each event was calculated using 5, 10, 15, 30, and 60 minute intervals. - Rainfall energy for each event was calculated using two methods: 1) McGregor and others (1995) and 2) Wischmeier and Smith (1978 and 1981). - Rainfall erosivity for each event was calculated using two methods: 1) McGregor and others (1995) and 2) Wischmeier and Smith (1978 and 1981). - Antecedent rainfall (ARF) for each event was calculated by taking the sum of the total amount of rain for a period of days (not events) before the beginning of the event associated with the flow event and reported in inches.

enttyp.enttypd: Comma Separated Value (CSV) file containing rain event data collected from USGS sites monitoring precipitation data and computed rainfall metrics.

attr.attrdef: Unique USGS site number where precipitation data was collected and associated with the edge-of-field monitoring site identified in the‘USGS_Station_Number’, ‘Field_Name’ and/or ‘All_Field_Names’ columns within the ‘EOF_Site_Table.csv’ and ‘All_EOF_StormEventLoadsRainCalculated.csv’ data tables.

edom.edomvd: University of Wisconsin Platteville Pioneer Farm

attr.attrdef: Unique short names for each edge-of-field monitoring site associated to the USGS sites monitoring precipitation data in 'USGS_Station_Number_for_Precipitation'

attrdomv.udom: Site information for each field name can be found in the 'EOF_Site_Table.csv' data table. Multiple field names are separated by "|". May include numbers, letters, and/or characters.

attr.attrdef: Date and time when rain event started in mm/dd/yyyy HH:MM

attrdomv.udom: Date and time in two-digit month/two-digit day/four-digit year two-digit hour:two-digit minute in Universal Time Coordinated (UTC) time zone

attr.attrdef: Date and time when rain event ended in mm/dd/yyyy HH:MM

attrdomv.udom: Date and time in two-digit month/two-digit day/four-digit year two-digit hour:two-digit minute in Universal Time Coordinated (UTC) time zone

attr.attrdef: Total rain amount monitored at the USGS site monitoring precipitation identified in ‘USGS_Station_Number_for_Precipitation’ and associated to distinct rain event indicated in the 'StartDate' and 'EndDate' columns.

attrdomv.udom: Total amount of precipitation measured, in inches

attr.attrdef: Duration of rain event

attrdomv.udom: Units: hours. NA occurs when rain depth is 0.01 because it indicates there was only one tip of the tipping bucket, therefore duration cannot be computed.

attr.attrdef: Rainfall intensity over the entire rain event calculated by dividing 'rain' by 'duration'

attrdomv.udom: Units: inches per hour

attr.attrdef: Maximum 5-minute rainfall intensity of rain event

attrdomv.udom: Units: inches per hour

attrdomv.udom: Units: inches per hour

attrdomv.udom: Units: inches per hour

attr.attrdef: Maximum 60-minute rainfall intensity of rain event

attrdomv.udom: Units: inches per hour

attr.attrdef: Calculated rainfall energy to drive erosion using McGregor (1995)

attrdomv.udom: Units: foot-ton X inch per acre

attr.attrdef: Calculated erosive power of the rainfall using McGregor (1995)

attrdomv.udom: Units: 100 X foot-ton X inch per acre per hour

attr.attrdef: Calculated rainfall energy to drive erosion using formulas based on Wischmeier and Smith (1979 and 1981)

attrdomv.udom: Units: foot-ton X inch per acre

attr.attrdef: Calculated erosive power of the rainfall using formulas based on Wischmeier and Smith (1979 and 1981)

attrdomv.udom: Units: 100 X foot-ton X inch per acre per hour

attr.attrdef: The Antecedent RainFall (ARF) depth calculated by summing the total precipitation monitored for a period of one day before the beginning of the indicated rain event in ‘StartDate’

attrdomv.udom: Cumulative depth of rain in inches

attr.attrdef: The Antecedent RainFall (ARF) depth calculated by summing the total precipitation monitored for a period of two days before the beginning of the indicated rain event in ‘StartDate’

attrdomv.udom: Cumulative depth of rain in inches

attr.attrdef: The Antecedent RainFall (ARF) depth calculated by summing the total precipitation monitored for a period of seven days before the beginning of the indicated rain event in ‘StartDate’

attrdomv.udom: Cumulative depth of rain in inches

attr.attrdef: The Antecedent RainFall (ARF) depth calculated by summing the total precipitation monitored for a period of fourteen days before the beginning of the indicated rain event in ‘StartDate’

attrdomv.udom: Cumulative depth of rain in inches

enttyp.enttypd: Comma Separated Value (CSV) file containing water-quality and flow data collected at edge-of-field monitoring sites for flow events and calculated flow metrics data.

attr.attrdef: Indicator that the event occurred when ground was frozen at any depth

edom.edomvd: The ground was not frozen during the event
The ground was frozen during the event

edom.edomvd: The flow in this event is associated with baseflow, groundwater flow, melting snow, or melting frozen ground and not a monitored precipitation event

enttyp.enttypd: Comma Separated Value (CSV) file containing combined flow event data.

attr.attrdef: Unique USGS edge-of-field monitoring site number where hydrological data is collected
attr.attrdefs: USGS Water Data for the Nation

codesetd.codesetn: USGS Water Data for the Nation

attr.attrdef: Unique short name for 'USGS_Station_Number'

attrdomv.udom: Unique values, may include numbers, letters, and/or characters.

attr.attrdef: Cooperative Program

edom.edomvd: Great Lakes Restoration Initiative – Priority Watersheds

attr.attrdef: Indicator that water-quality sample was a discrete sample

edom.edomvd: Water-quality sample was not discrete and sub-samples were combined to represent the entire flow event
Water-quality sample was discrete and represents one point in time and not the entire flow event

attr.attrdef: Indicator that event water-quality concentration was estimated as described in process step 3.

edom.edomvd: Data are reported from the lab and not estimated

attr.attrdef: Indicator that the event occurred when ground was frozen at any depth

edom.edomvd: The ground was not frozen during the event
The ground was frozen during the event

attr.attrdef: Indicator of the type of flow associated with this event: baseflow or storm flow.

edom.edomvd: The flow in this event is associated with baseflow, groundwater flow, melting snow, or melting frozen ground and not a monitored precipitation event
The runoff causing the flow event is associated with a monitored precipitation event (rain, snow, or sleet)

attr.attrdef: Unique flow event identifier

attrdomv.udom: Unique values, may include numbers, letters, and/or characters

attr.attrdef: Number of sub-flow or precipitation events combined to compute flow and rainfall metrics. Mutltiple events were combined when events occurred within two hours of each other.
Date and time when the flow event started

attrdomv.udom: Date and time in two-digit month/two-digit day/four-digit year two-digit hour:two-digit minute in Universal Time Coordinated (UTC) time zone

attr.attrdef: Date and time when the flow event ended

attrdomv.udom: Date and time in two-digit month/two-digit day/four-digit year two-digit hour:two-digit minute in Universal Time Coordinated (UTC) time zone

attr.attrdef: Total runoff volume per flow event

attrdomv.udom: Volume in cubic feet

attr.attrdef: Maximum discharge per flow event

attrdomv.udom: Discharge in cubic feet per second

attr.attrdef: Fraction of the total runoff volume that was estimated

attrdomv.udom: Unitless value between 0 and 1. Larger values indicate more of the total runoff volume for the event was estimated.

attrdomv.udom: If the ‘discrete’ column is “0” then the laboratory reported data are flow-weighted average concentrations, while a “1” indicates the reported data are discrete concentrations. Concentration data are reported in milligrams per liter in accuracy reported by the analyzing laboratory

attr.attrdef: Total rain amount monitored at the USGS site monitoring precipitation identified in ‘USGS_Station_Number_for_Precipitation’ and associated to distinct rain event indicated in the 'StartDate' and 'EndDate' columns.

attrdomv.udom: Total amount of precipitation measured, in inches

attr.attrdef: Duration of rain event

attrdomv.udom: Units: hours. NA occurs when rain depth is 0.01 because it indicates there was only one tip of the tipping bucket, therefore duration cannot be computed.

attr.attrdef: Rainfall intensity over the entire rain event calculated by dividing 'rain' by 'duration'

attrdomv.udom: Units: inches per hour

attr.attrdef: Maximum 5-minute rainfall intensity of rain event

attrdomv.udom: Units: inches per hour

attr.attrdef: Maximum 10-minute rainfall intensity of rain event

attrdomv.udom: Units: inches per hour

attr.attrdef: Maximum 15-minute rainfall intensity of rain event

attrdomv.udom: Units: inches per hour

attr.attrdef: Maximum 30-minute rainfall intensity of rain event

attrdomv.udom: Units: inches per hour

attr.attrdef: Maximum 60-minute rainfall intensity of rain event

attrdomv.udom: Units: inches per hour

attr.attrdef: Calculated rainfall energy to drive erosion using McGregor (1995)

attrdomv.udom: Units: foot-ton X inch per acre

attr.attrdef: Calculated erosive power of the rainfall using McGregor (1995)

attrdomv.udom: Units: 100 X foot-ton X inch per acre per hour

attr.attrdef: Calculated rainfall energy to drive erosion using formulas based on Wischmeier and Smith (1979 and 1981)

attrdomv.udom: Units: foot-ton X inch per acre

attr.attrdef: Calculated erosive power of the rainfall using formulas based on Wischmeier and Smith (1979 and 1981)

attrdomv.udom: Units: 100 X foot-ton X inch per acre per hour

attr.attrdef: The Antecedent RainFall (ARF) depth calculated by summing the total precipitation monitored for a period of one day before the beginning of the indicated rain event in ‘StartDate’

attrdomv.udom: Cumulative depth of rain in inches

attr.attrdef: The Antecedent RainFall (ARF) depth calculated by summing the total precipitation monitored for a period of two days before the beginning of the indicated rain event in ‘StartDate’

attrdomv.udom: Cumulative depth of rain in inches

attr.attrdef: The Antecedent RainFall (ARF) depth calculated by summing the total precipitation monitored for a period of seven days before the beginning of the indicated rain event in ‘StartDate’

attrdomv.udom: Cumulative depth of rain in inches

attr.attrdef: The Antecedent RainFall (ARF) depth calculated by summing the total precipitation monitored for a period of fourteen days before the beginning of the indicated rain event in ‘StartDate’

attrdomv.udom: Cumulative depth of rain in inches

attr.attrdef: Remark code associated with the rainfall metric calculations; may contain multiple flags separated by a space

edom.edomvd: The runoff volume in 'runoff_volume' divided by the rain volume is greater than 80 percent. Runoff likely did not capture the full rain volume. Where rain volume is equal to rain total in 'rain' multiplied by the catchment area provided in 'Area' of the 'EOF_Site_Table.csv' data table.
This is a tile site, which might explain why rain total in 'rain' was 0 even though there was runoff, or why duration was multiple days.

enttyp.enttypd: Comma Separated Value (CSV) file containing site information.

attr.attrdef: Unique USGS edge-of-field monitoring site number where hydrological data is collected
attr.attrdefs: USGS Water Data for the Nation

codesetd.codesetn: USGS Water Data for the Nation

attr.attrdef: USGS site name for the site in 'USGS_Station_Number'

attrdomv.udom: descriptive station name

attr.attrdef: Abbreviation for state where site indicated in 'USGS_Station_Number' is located.
Unique short name for 'USGS_Station_Number'

attrdomv.udom: Unique values, may include numbers, letters, and/or characters.

attr.attrdef: Cooperative program

edom.edomvd: Great Lakes Restoration Initiative – Priority Watersheds

attr.attrdef: Type of edge-of-field monitoring site

edom.edomvd: Surface edge-of-field site located in areas where runoff exits agricultural fields.
Subsurface tile edge-of-field site located at drainage tile outlets, in a ditch or stream, or in-line with the subsurface tile system

attr.attrdef: Range of water years that flow and water-quality data was collected at site in 'USGS_Station_Number'

attrdomv.udom: Range of years in four-digit year format with years separated by a dash. The beginning of the water year starts on October 1st and ends on September 30th. When a year range is incomplete, ending with a dash (-), then data collection is ongoing.

attr.attrdef: Approximate start date of flow and water-quality data collection at site

attrdomv.udom: Date in two-digit month/two-digit day/four-digit year

attr.attrdef: Approximate end date of flow, or water-quality data collection at site

edom.edomvd: not applicable; no end date at the time of this publication

attrdomv.udom: Date in two-digit month/two-digit day/four-digit year

attr.attrdef: Specific water years when monitoring equipment was not installed for the full water year and therefore are not useable for computing annual flow, load, or rainfall metrics.

attrdomv.udom: Four digit years in which equipment was installed or removed mid-year. The beginning of the water year starts on October 1st and ends on September 30th.

attr.attrdef: Specific water years with incomplete data due to issues with monitoring equipment and therefore are not useable for computing annual flow, load, or rainfall metrics.

attrdomv.udom: four digit years in which data collection had significant gaps or was incomplete. The beginning of the water year starts on October 1st and ends on September 30th.

attr.attrdef: Number of water years with complete data collection

attrdomv.udom: Total number of complete water years in the period of record at site in 'USGS_Station_Number'. The beginning of the water year starts on October 1st and ends on September 30th.

attr.attrdef: Drainage Area (or catchment) of the agricultural field where the edge-of-field site in ‘USGS_Station_Number’ is located

attrdomv.udom: Units: acres

attr.attrdef: Unique USGS site number where precipitation data was collected and associated with the edge-of-field site in 'USGS_Station_Number'
attr.attrdefs: USGS Water Data for the Nation

codesetd.codesetn: USGS Water Data for the Nation

attr.attrdef: USGS site name for the site in 'USGS_Station_Number_for_Precipitation'
attr.attrdefs: USGS Water Data for the Nation

codesetd.codesetn: USGS Water Data for the Nation

attr.attrdef: Primary production type of the agricultural field where the edge-of-field monitoring site in 'USGS_Station_Number' is located

attrdomv.udom: Character string describing primary production at the edge-of-field monitoring site in 'USGS_Station_Number'

attr.attrdef: Type of crop rotation in the agricultural field where the edge-of-field monitoring site in 'USGS_Station_Number' is located

attrdomv.udom: Character string describing crop rotation at site in 'USGS_Station_Number'

attr.attrdef: Dominant land use in the catchment where the edge-of-field monitoring site in 'USGS_Station_Number' is located

edom.edomvd: Areas used for the production of annual crops. Crop vegetation accounts for greater than 20 percent of total vegetation.

Areas dominated by gramanoid or herbaceous vegetation, generally greater than 80 percent of total vegetation. These areas are not subject to intensive management such as tilling, but can be utilized for grazing.

Areas of grasses, legumes, or grass-legume mixtures planted for livestock grazing or the production of seed or hay crops, typically on a perennial cycle. Pasture/hay vegetation accounts for greater than 20 percent of total vegetation.
Areas with a mixture of constructed materials and vegetation. Impervious surfaces account for 20 to 49 percent of total cover. These areas most commonly include single-family housing units.

attr.attrdef: Indicator if land in the catchment where the edge-of-field monitoring site in 'USGS_Station_Number' is located is tilled

edom.edomvd: Land management does not include tilling

attr.attrdef: Indicator if manure is applied to land in the catchment where the edge-of-field monitoring site in 'USGS_Station_Number' is located
Dominant soil type in the catchment where the edge-of-field monitoring site in 'USGS_Station_Number' is located

cntaddr.address: Denver Federal Center, Building 810, Mail Stop 302

distinfo.distliab: Unless otherwise stated, all data, metadata and related materials are considered to satisfy the quality standards relative to the purpose for which the data were collected. Although these data and associated metadata have been reviewed for accuracy and completeness and approved for release by the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS), no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the display or utility of the data on any other system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty.

cntorgp.cntorg: U.S. Geological Survey, Upper Midwest Water Science Center

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Biological Data Profile of the Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata
